@asset.description: Allows you to reference a file relative to the current file

@documentation.description: Compiles the JSON documentation of the given entity into JavaScript code so it can be used to display information about that entity

@format.description: Returns the formatted string version of the code it's given and the result of the code in a tuple: Tuple(a, String)

@svg.description: Allows you to inline an SVG file as HTML

catch.description: Mint catch block for handling errors

children.description: Access child elements which are passed to a Mint component

connect.description: Connecting to a Mint store allows you to access any state values it contains

decode.description: Decode JS data to be used in Mint

encode.description: Encode Mint data to be used in JS

enum.description: A Mint enum describes data which contains different type-variants

finally.description: Mint finally block for running code after an asynchronous block has executed

get.description: The get keyword defines a computed property in Mint

global component.description: Mint global components are: globally accessible, only rendered once and rendered automatically alongside the Main component

module.description: A Mint module is a container for a set of relatable functions

next.description: A Mint next expression allows you to set state within a store or component

parallel.description: A Mint parallel block runs asynchronous code in parallel

property.description: Mint property for passing values to components, omitting a default value makes it required

record.description: Mint data structure with a fixed set of keys

routes.description: Mint routes block for defining routes and setting their state

sequence.description: A Mint sequence block runs asynchronous code in sequence

state.description: Define store or component state in Mint

store.description: Mint store for handling application state

then.description: Mint then block for handling the results of an asynchronous task

use provider.description: A Mint Provider represents a source of asynchronous events. To subscribe to a Provider, you use it and pass it a record that contains the subscription data

when.description: A Mint when block runs code in a for...of loop only when the given condition is met
